result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Khalar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 1 day sentence credit, if revoked.
Consecutive to: Case 15CM116, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to court costs.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint or any family members.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert J. Khalar in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.



Court orders the following:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Consecutive to:  15CM116
1 Day Credit.
STAYED.


Term of Probation:  15 Months.
Consecutive to:  15CM116
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No violent contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complaint or any family members.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
filed by defendant's wife in regards to this case.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert J. Khalar in court, in custody (PO HOLD).  
Defendant doesn't qualify for Public Defender Representation.

Defendant is being revoked on 15CM116.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert J. Khalar in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victims listed in the criminal complaint.

Defendant Robert J. Khalar in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
